<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
<!DOCTYPE DOCSENT SYSTEM './docsent.dtd'>
<DOCSENT DID='23'>
  <BODY>
    <HEADLINE>
      <S SNO='1' PAR='1' RSNT='1'>ABCNEWS.com : Plane Slams Into Milan Skyscraper</S>
    </HEADLINE>
    <TEXT>
      <S SNO='2' PAR='2' RSNT='1'>The Pirelli Building in Milan, Italy, was hit by a small plane.</S>
      <S SNO='3' PAR='3' RSNT='1'>(ABCNEWS.com)   8212; A small plane crashed into a skyscraper in downtown Milan today, setting several floors of the 32-story building on fire.</S>
      <S SNO='4' PAR='4' RSNT='1'>At least two people are dead, including the pilot, Italy's ANSA wire service said.</S>
      <S SNO='5' PAR='5' RSNT='1'>The plane crashed into the 25th floor of the Pirelli building in downtown Milan.</S>
      <S SNO='6' PAR='6' RSNT='1'>The weather was clear at the time of the crash.</S>
      <S SNO='7' PAR='7' RSNT='1'>Italian TV reported the bottom floors of the building had been evacuated, and that many people were injured.</S>
      <S SNO='8' PAR='8' RSNT='1'>The Associated Press reported only the pilot was on board.</S>
      <S SNO='9' PAR='9' RSNT='1'>The plane was destined for Italy's capital Rome, but there were conflicting reports as to whether it had come from Locarno, Switzerland or Sofia, Bulgaria.</S>
      <S SNO='10' PAR='10' RSNT='1'>Smoke poured from the opening as police and ambulances rushed to the area.</S>
      <S SNO='11' PAR='11' RSNT='1'>The fire devastated two floors of the building, but is now under control, reported ABCNEWS' Rome bureau.</S>
      <S SNO='12' PAR='12' RSNT='1'>There were initial fears that the crash could have been a terrorist attack, but local officials now say it was probably an accident.</S>
      <S SNO='13' PAR='13' RSNT='1'>A transport official told Reuters the plane had reported problems with its undercarriage and was circling the city ahead of trying to land at a local airport.</S>
      <S SNO='14' PAR='14' RSNT='1'>Police officer Celerissimo De Simone told The AP the pilot of the Piper aircraft had sent out a distress call at 5:50 p.m. just before crashing.</S>
      <S SNO='15' PAR='15' RSNT='1'>Italian TV said the pilot SOS involved a technical problem.The crash happened during rush hour, as office workers were ending their day.</S>
      <S SNO='16' PAR='16' RSNT='1'>A small tourist plane crashed into the tallest building in Milan.</S>
      <S SNO='17' PAR='17' RSNT='1'>(ABCNEWS.com/Magellan Geographix) The Pirelli building houses the administrative offices of the local Lombardy region and sits next to the city's central train station.</S>
      <S SNO='18' PAR='18' RSNT='1'>It is one of the world's tallest concrete buildings, and one of the main symbols of Milan.</S>
      <S SNO='19' PAR='19' RSNT='1'>At his lunchtime press briefing today, White House press secretary Ari Fleischer told reporters: "The president just moments ago was informed about the incident in Milan.</S>
      <S SNO='20' PAR='20' RSNT='1'>I have no additional information at all for you at this time.</S>
      <S SNO='21' PAR='21' RSNT='1'>This is a breaking story and we don't have anything else beyond that   8212; the president has been informed."</S>
      <S SNO='22' PAR='22' RSNT='1'>"I think you can presume that we will be   8212; if we are not already   8212; in touch with Italian authorities and will ascertain precisely what the facts are," he said.</S>
      <S SNO='23' PAR='23' RSNT='1'>The world has been on edge about airplane crashes into buildings since the Sept. 11 terror attacks.</S>
      <S SNO='24' PAR='24' RSNT='1'>On Jan. 5, a 15-year-old boy crashed a stolen plane into a building in Tampa, Fla.</S>
      <S SNO='25' PAR='25' RSNT='1'>He was the only casualty.</S>
      <S SNO='26' PAR='26' RSNT='1'>April 18   8212; The 32-story Pirelli Building, struck today by a small airplane, is Milan's tallest building, and is one of the world's highest concrete skyscrapers.</S>
      <S SNO='27' PAR='27' RSNT='1'>Built in the 1950s, the office building stands 32 stories tall, or about 417 feet, according to the Web site, SkyScraperPage.com.</S>
      <S SNO='28' PAR='28' RSNT='1'>By comparison, New York's Empire State Building is 102 stories, or 1,455 feet.</S>
      <S SNO='29' PAR='29' RSNT='1'>Centrally located near the city's train station, the Pirelli Building was designed by the architect Gio Ponti, and one of Italy's most important 20th-century structural engineers, Pier Luigi Nervi (1891-1979), known for his use of reinforced concrete.</S>
      <S SNO='30' PAR='30' RSNT='1'>Copyright   2002 ABCNEWS Internet Ventures.</S>
    </TEXT>
  </BODY>
</DOCSENT>
